page.title: 07FARMING 3
page.content:
Farming has become more intensive because of increased availability of fertilisers,which enables farmers to keep more stock.More mechanisation has decreased the number of farmworkers by about a quarter. The advent of electricity and an indoor water supply revolutionised the life of the farmer's wife.
A typical farm in the region would be Coldwell,which is an independant farm,of 300 acres run by farmer and 1 hind.Hay is the only crop grown.The farmer keeps cows and calves and black faced ewes.The fields are enclosed with sod cast dykes,there are newly planted and old woods for shelter.He keeps twice as many sheep now ,has changed from horses to tractors,has fewer farm buildings and has changed from store cattle to cows and calves.
